definition: the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
leopard/panther

sentences.english: How did Mary make most of her money?
sentences.chinese: 玛丽全豹的钱是奈何赚到的？

sentences.english: While waiting everyone moved to the other corner.
sentences.chinese: 在守候的功夫，全豹人移去了另一个角落等他。

sentences.english: All the local clergy joined in the fun the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 当地全豹的牧师出席了仪式。

sentences.english: Wishingyou all the blessings of a beautiful Christmas season!
sentences.chinese: 愿具有圣诞节全豹美的祝愿。

sentences.english: How did Mary make every her money?
sentences.chinese: 玛丽全豹的钱是如何赚到的？

sentences.english: How did Mary make up to ingl her money?
sentences.chinese: 玛丽全豹的钱是若何赚到的？

sentences.english: Pull one hair and move watch one spot all over and see whole picture.
sentences.chinese: 牵一发而动全身观一斑而见全豹。

sentences.english: All characters in the plan are imaginary.
sentences.chinese: 书中全豹的人物都是伪造捏造的。

sentences.english: You may know by a handful the whole sack.
sentences.chinese: 抓一把而知全袋，窥一斑以见全豹。

definition: lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
lit. one spot (on the leopard)/fig. one small item in a big scheme
to find out about/to discover
lit. to see one spot on a leopard/fig. a restricted view
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
one or two/a few
some cases picked out as example/to highlight
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
knowledge and experience
to infer
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
